intro: Senecio salicifolius, commonly known as the willow-leaf groundsell, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters. It is a hardy species that thrives in full sun and is often used in rock gardens or as a ground cover.
